item.title: Andrea add a quote by robert harris
item.description: "To say she was my girlfriend was absurd: no one the wrong side of thirty has a girlfriend… I suppose I ought to have realize it’s ominous that forty thousand years of human language had failed to produce a word for our relationship." -- robert harris

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Natalie Babbitt
item.description: "Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live." -- Natalie Babbitt

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Andrea add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Andrea add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Andrea add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "She had a pretty gift for quotation, which is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Adlai E. Stevenson
item.description: "It's hard to lead a cavalry charge if you think you look funny on a horse." -- Adlai E. Stevenson

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Andrea add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "When I despair, I remember that all through history the way of truth and love have always won. There have been tyrants and murderers, and for a time, they can seem invincible, but in the end, they always fall. Think of it--always." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "There are years that ask questions and years that answer." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "With school turning out more runners, jumpers, racers, tinkerers, grabbers, snatchers, fliers, and swimmers instead of examiners, critics, knowers, and imaginative creators, the word 'intellectual,' of course, became the swear word it deserved to be." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Andrea add a quote by alice walker
item.description: "I think it pisses God off if you walk by the color purple in a field somewhere and don't notice it." -- alice walker

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "Punctuality is the virtue of the bored." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: Andrea add a quote by John F. Kennedy
item.description: "The Chinese use two brush strokes to write the word 'crisis.' One brush stroke stands for danger; the other for opportunity. In a crisis, be aware of the danger--but recognize the opportunity." -- John F. Kennedy

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Arthur Miller
item.description: "Don't be seduced into thinking that that which does not make a profit is without value." -- Arthur Miller

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Andrea add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree. " -- Michael Crichton

item.title: Andrea add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The first thing I do in the morning is brush my teeth and sharpen my tongue." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Andrea add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Double, double, toil and trouble; Fire burn, and cauldron bubble!" -- William Shakespeare
